abstract: The long-awaited listing of shares in Time Warner Cable — the United States’ No. 2 cable provider after Comcast — could be delayed until March because of the legal wrangling in Adelphia Communications‘ bankruptcy case. That is one of the possibilities considered by Bear Stearns analyst Spencer Wang, who wrote in a research note Tuesday that, if the internecine battles among Adelphia’s creditors continue, Time Warner could decide to try a traditional initial public offering as opposed to floating the stock through a court-approved reorganization plan.
lead_paragraph: The long-awaited listing of shares in Time Warner Cable — the United States’ No. 2 cable provider after Comcast — could be delayed until March because of the legal wrangling in Adelphia Communications‘ bankruptcy case. That is one of the possibilities considered by Bear Stearns analyst Spencer Wang, who wrote in a research note Tuesday that, if the internecine battles among Adelphia’s creditors continue, Time Warner could decide to try a traditional initial public offering as opposed to floating the stock through a court-approved reorganization plan.

headline.main: Static Clouds Time Warner Cable Offering
